intro: Manicaria atricha, commonly known as the black maniçaba, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its long, trailing stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with red markings, which are followed by distinctive, spiny capsules. Its fibrous roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
